How to Use the Mirror ðŸŒŸ

This mirror site for huggingface.co helps you quickly and stably download models and datasets when the main site is blocked.

Method 1: Web Download

Search on this site and download files from the model page's Files and Version section.

Method 2: Using huggingface-cli

huggingface-cli is the official command-line tool with download functionality.

1. Install dependencies
pip install -U huggingface_hub
2. Set environment variable
Linux/macOS 
export HF_ENDPOINT=https://your-mirror-domain
Windows PowerShell 
$env:HF_ENDPOINT = "https://your-mirror-domain"
We recommend adding this to your ~/.bashrc or profile.
3.1 Download a model 
huggingface-cli download --resume-download gpt2 --local-dir gpt2
3.2 Download a dataset 
huggingface-cli download --repo-type dataset --resume-download wikitext --local-dir wikitext
You can add --local-dir-use-symlinks False to disable file symlinks.

Method 3: Environment variable (non-intrusive)

For Python scripts, you can set the environment variable directly:

HF_ENDPOINT=https://your-mirror-domain python your_script.py

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Some projects require login, how can I download them?

A: For gated repositories that require permission, this mirror doesn't support login for security reasons. You should first visit the official Hugging Face site to login and request access, then get an Access Token and use that with the mirror for CLI downloads:

With huggingface-cli: Add --token parameter 
                        huggingface-cli download --token hf_*** --resume-download meta-llama/Llama-2-7b-hf --local-dir Llama-2-7b-hf
